publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4364 Pauline McNeill: Girls’ and Women’s Football on the Way Up!—That the Parliament welcomes the new sponsorship deal between the Scottish Women’s Premier Football League and Thompsons Solicitors; congratulates Thompsons on taking this important step in the recognition of the sport; notes that girls’ football is the fastest growing sport in Scotland and that some 40 teams were represented in the Amicus Scottish Cup; acknowledges Greater Glasgow NHS Board’s promotion of women’s football as a way to keep active and also recognises the efforts of many local organisations, such as Broomhill Sports Club in the west of Glasgow, and calls on the Scottish Executive to promote women’s football actively and also to support schools which encourage the involvement of girls in football and take part in girls’ football leagues.

S2M-4364 Girls’ and Women’s Football on the Way Up! (lodged on 9 May 2006) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Maureen Macmillan*, Colin Fox*, Tommy Sheridan*, Sarah Boyack*, Marlyn Glen*, Bristow Muldoon*, Bruce Crawford*, Paul Martin*, Jackie Baillie*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Frances Curran*

S2M-4364 Girls’ and Women’s Football on the Way Up! (lodged on 9 May 2006) Trish Godman*, Karen Gillon*, Bill Aitken*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Cathie Craigie*, Eleanor Scott*, Ms Sandra White*

S2M-4364 Pauline McNeill: Girls’ and Women’s Football on the Way Up!—That the Parliament welcomes the new sponsorship deal between the Scottish Women’s Premier Football League and Thompsons Solicitors; congratulates Thompsons on taking this important step in the recognition of the sport; notes that girls’ football is the fastest growing sport in Scotland and that some 40 teams were represented in the Amicus Scottish Cup; acknowledges Greater Glasgow NHS Board’s promotion of women’s football as a way to keep active and also recognises the efforts of many local organisations, such as Broomhill Sports Club in the west of Glasgow, and calls on the Scottish Executive to promote women’s football actively and also to support schools which encourage the involvement of girls in football and take part in girls’ football leagues. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Dr Elaine Murray, Maureen Macmillan, Colin Fox, Tommy Sheridan, Sarah Boyack, Marlyn Glen, Bristow Muldoon, Bruce Crawford, Paul Martin, Jackie Baillie, Mr Brian Monteith, Frances Curran, Trish Godman, Karen Gillon, Bill Aitken, Mr Frank McAveety, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Cathie Craigie, Eleanor Scott, Ms Sandra White
S2M-4364 Girls’ and Women’s Football on the Way Up! (lodged on 9 May 2006) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-4364 Girls’ and Women’s Football on the Way Up! (lodged on 9 May 2006) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4364 Girls’ and Women’s Football on the Way Up! (lodged on 9 May 2006) Scott Barrie*
S2M-4364 Girls’ and Women’s Football on the Way Up! (lodged on 9 May 2006) Cathy Peattie*
S2M-4364 Girls’ and Women’s Football on the Way Up! (lodged on 9 May 2006) Helen Eadie*
S2M-4364 Girls’ and Women’s Football on the Way Up! (lodged on 9 May 2006) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S2M-4364 Girls’ and Women’s Football on the Way Up! (lodged on 9 May 2006) Dennis Canavan*
S2M-4364 Girls’ and Women’s Football on the Way Up! (lodged on 9 May 2006) Robin Harper*
